title: rclone mount Cache:sub-bucket/ not working
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
When I use the root of a backing store for the Cache remote I'm unable to mount a sub-bucket or the Cache remote. I.E. if Cache.remote = SOMETHING:subBucket/ I can mount Cache: no problem, but if Cache.remote = SOMETHING: when I mount Cache:subBucket/ It gives an error in the rclone logs and lists the root bucket instead.

Cache Config:
```
[WWW-CACHE]
type = cache
remote = WWW:
writes = true
```

#### What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
other --fast-list --cache-workers 10 WWW-CACHE: /shared/sites/www.cornercafe.net -vv --cache-db-purge
2018/09/07 18:44:29 DEBUG : rclone: Version "

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Linux (ubuntu xenial)

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Cloud Storage

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```
rclone --uid 33 --gid 33 mount --allow-other --fast-list --cache-workers 10 WWW-CACHE:cornercafe-net-local/ /shared/sites/www.cornercafe.net -vv
```

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```
2018/09/07 18:39:23 DEBUG : Using config file from "/root/.rclone.conf"
2018/09/07 18:39:23 ERROR : Failed to save new token in config file: section 'WWW' not found
```
